prompt: Write a program that takes multiple lists as input, and returns a new list that contains only the elements that are common to all lists.
answer:
Here's the Python code that implements the common elements finder as per your specifications:

```python
# Create lists
list1 = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]
list2 = [4, 5, 6, 7, 8]
list3 = [1, 2, 3, 7, 8, 9]

# Find the intersection of the lists
common_elements = set(list1) & set(list2) & set(list3)

# Print the common elements
print(common_elements)
```

When you run this code, it will output: `set()` because there are no elements that are common to all three lists.

If you want to find the common elements between any two lists, you can modify the code as follows:

```python
# Create lists
list1 = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]
list2 = [4, 5, 6, 7, 8]
list3 = [1, 2, 3, 7, 8, 9]

# Find the intersection of list1 and list2
common_elements_12 = set(list1) & set(list2)
print(common_elements_12)

# Find the intersection of list1 and list3
common_elements_13 = set(list1) & set(list3)
print(common_elements_13)

# Find the intersection of list2 and list3
common_elements_23 = set(list2) & set(list3)
print(common_elements_23)
```

This code will output the common elements between each pair of lists.
